reviews.review_msg: TERRIBLEâ€¦. GLAD HE IS RETIRING SO NO ONE ELSE HAS TO ENDURE AN EXAM LIKE THAT FINAL!!!!

No matter how you study, the final will end your life. It was WAY more in depth than the midterms, it was like it was from a different class. Qs felt designed to trick and I don't see how anyone will pass if it's not curved. I'm a good student and all, but I left the final and went straight to the liquor store. Avoid this if you value your dignity

This professor will outright lie and mislead. He may promise that the final will cover only what's in the slides: this is not true. It will cover slides, textbook, and also in person lecture. Good thing it's 48% of your grade! The midterms cover shallower information than the final, even on things that appear in both, and without warning. AVOID.

I studied hard and attended every class, material is easy enough. Do NOT take this. The prof was fine. I blame the super weird and disorganized TA for the fact that this class made want to jump out a window-- e.g. I asked for details on the midterm, and he laughed and said I would know after the exam. Class was comically bad, please get a new TA.

All negative comments are def from students who never studied or paid attention in this class, this is a HARD and CONTENT HEAVY course, if you are NOT willing to study, DO NOT take this, exams are worth a lot. Amandio is not a horrible prof!!! He was super nice and would explain stuff again if he was asked. Lecs are boring but he teaches well.

Horrible class!! Do not recommend at all, final was worth like 48% it was very difficult. He's a terrible prof very boring and not good at explaining anything. He has a very monotone voice lectures were hard to get through

The class itself is a GPA booster, but they mean with other professors. I was warned even by the TA about this professor, and how he has a sleepy voice and is very slow. Its true. Possibly one of the most disorganized classes I have ever taken. IMPOSSIBLE to understand his lecture slides, and most material on the midterms are not even on it.

Final exam is worth 48% of total grade and was very different from midterm
The projects and assignments aren't too bad but they barely even count towards your grade

The lectures were ok , little boring for students who do not have interest in this field. Mid terms were very easy but the final was so hard and it is Commulative and weighs around 38 to 40 percent. Worst MCQ i have ever seen so confusing and hard , would not recommend.
just overall not helpful. reads from slides that have little information, does not answer any questions and expects students to just handle it themselves. theres a reason this guy has 0 stars.

He was fair. Also took time to explain concepts, answer questions, and go in-depth to provide context. I liked him. He gets lots of hate, hence his rating. Lectures can be boring. Everything you need to know is in both the textbook and course slides, some material does not overlap. The midterms were not so bad, but the final was tough.
you are probably on this to decide whether you should take this guy for bpk110. do not. just saved u a bunch of time.

If you like your life (and gpa), steer clear. Mandatory textbook (he wrote), horrendous lectures where he kills time by restating the same things, textbook is disorganized, unclear, questions are worded terribly, he is unwilling to help, and marking scheme does not correspond with what is in his textbook. Content is super specific, not focused.

Lectures are boring and slides are copy-pasted from the textbook he wrote (and makes you buy). Midterms are manageable but the final was 100x harder. Grades super hard and specifically. Hardest multiple choice I have ever encountered. Absolutely 0 redeeming qualities, do not take classes with professor. Worst prof/class I've had.

Absolutely terrible way of making tests. Everytime he talks you want to fall asleep. You do not understand anything that is going on the slides that he made and his textbook THAT HE MADE US BUY is so random and out of place. Again, TERRIBLE way of making tests, the tests I took for this course had the most random ass questions I have ever seen.

This guy deserves his rating. He cancelled the first class and said he would post the lecture recording, then proceeded to not do so. He makes you buy a crappy textbook he wrote, and the format of the textbook is extremely confusing. His voice is monotone and makes you want to fall asleep. He should probably retire.

Don't take this class if you don't need to. Gave us 18 mins for 54 questions in the first part of our final exam worth half our grade. Exams are so off topic were in and our class was Tuesday but our final was on Wednesday I had to take the exam during my shift at work because prof doesn't take into consideration that we're not available everyday!

This professor was absolutely horrible! If you can avoid having him as a prof.. do so! He does not teach you anything AT ALL. You get hit with a final worth almost half your grade (48%) and on this final just random information (54 TF Q's in 18 mins) and when you approach him he is so unreasonable. Horrible prof, shouldn't even be on in my opinion!

one of the worst profs at sfu. tests are based on what he finds interesting rather than textbook and he is overall very unreasonable. When I went to him to ask about a question I got wrong on the midterm and I referred to a textbook page to show I should have gotten it right he told me to "worry more about the next test as my grade wouldn't change"

difficult to hear him when speaking and is monotone. does not explain concepts very well and leaves you to figure out everything yourself. Don't expect any help from him because he won't help you, almost seems like he made a mistake choosing his profession as he is the least bit interested in teaching. STRESSFUL, HARD COURSE. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

he talked very quietly making it difficult to hear him. was very boring b/c he was very monotone. doesn't really explain things well (ta helped a lot) and kind of lets you figure it out yourself. the textbook did most of the teaching. two group projects and weekly quizzes. was only there for lectures and that's it. hard course and very stressful.

3 words: Worst. Experience. Ever. My experience with this professor definitely makes it into worst experiences at SFU. He is super disorganized, doesnt explain assignments or exam outlines, and his website is a joke. Nothing personal against him but he seemed like he couldnt care less about teaching his students (even though thats his job).

Nice prof. Only needed to study the textbook. This course is only really difficult if you have a non-science background, otherwise it was relatively easy, just plenty of material to study. Midterms and finals are weighted heavily, and answers must be quite specific. Asked a lot of 'details' that you may not expect. Some MC some short answer.
The fire alarm was going on and everyone was evaucating the building and he kept going on and on
This prof makes this course more difficult than it should be. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!
Literally take his class if you want to fail. He is the most BORING prof. I don't even know why I attended his lectures cause their useless!!! AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS

TERRIBLE PROF! really recommend avoiding him. i never attended lectures because whatever he would teach was irrelevant. you're better off just buying the textbook and memorizing the chapters because his exams are all textbook based. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR AND DO NOT TAKE HIM! His tests are also worth 85% of the class mark.. goodluck
lectures are useless. just read the textbook and hope the curve saves you. avoid at ALL costs.

understanding him during lecture was rough b/c he mumbles and barely talks loud enough for the mic to catch it. his refusal to use canvas made accessing his slides a nightmare and getting back grades was even worse. went on unnecessary tangents during lecture and wasted loads of time. avoid him if teaching yourself entire courses aren't your thing
Boring and monotone, half the class leaves during the break. 2 hour lecture feels like 10 hours. Makes interesting material boring. Doesn't use canvas. Avoid if possible.

Not an easy A like I thought, but you can do well by putting the time and effort. Rely mostly on the textbook material rather than his notes. Be ready to put in the time as it's a very demanding course. I never missed a lecture, but most of the class didn't show up to lectures or leave because they're pretty boring.. But the material is interesting

WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN! took it a gpa booster, and it did the opposite. worst marker ever, doesnt even give you points when you give right answer. very specific with details. literally have to memorize the textbook. the class is interesting itself, but highly recommend not taking with him. regret it

Lectures gave me zero benefit. Very monotone, quiet and boring when reading slides. No one in the class ever appears intrigued. Exams are marked harshly, low average among everyone. You're better  off reading the textbook since his slides miss a lot and don't explain things.

Took this class as a easy science credit. Lectures are super long, and very boring. Make sure you review diseases for the tests, as majority of the long answer questions are related to that topic.  5 quizzes in tutorials, and two word diet assignments are simple! Would be a better class, if he seemed to actually care about the topics discussed.
Lectures are boring, he is a very monotone speaker and it is difficult to stay focused the whole class. But tests are not too hard and he posts lecture slides online.

GPA BOOSTER! The tests were based off 95% from the textbook and I felt that the professor was fair on the exams. The projects and presentations were really easy but not worth enough. Quizzes every week super common sense. I wished the Professor was more enthusiastic and spoke louder/clearer. Read the textbook over and over and aced this course

Took very interesting and useful topics and made them boring. Lectures seemed to drag on forever. Was confusing at times, and didn't bother to clarify that well upon students' request. Both midterms were fairly easy, however final was nothing like the midterms and was much more difficult.

I actually really enjoyed 8:30 morning lectures with Leah when I took this course in Fall 2014. She always had funny, embarrassing stories to tell the class. The content is pretty detailed and interesting, but you have to study hard to memorize everything. Her assignments were easy and straightforward if you followed the instructions properly.

Lectures are dreadful and boring. The assignments are easy if you follow the examples properly. A lot of people disregarded them and ending up doing bad on them. The exams are okay, you have to study it isn't common sense. Just use the website provided and quiz yourself!!
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER. SHE TESTS RIDICULOUSLY AND RAMBLES ON ABOUT USELESS STORIES. YOU END UP WITH TWO LETER GRADES LOWER AFTER THE FINAL
Funny, embarrassing stories during lecture. Animated and laid-back. Test are somewhat difficult.

Leah is a good professor. She posts powerpoint notes online but she doesn't explain them in-depth in lectures, so you will need to spend lots of time on your own learning the material. Midterm and final are straight forward, if you study her  lecture notes you should do fine. There is an assignment worth 30% which is easy but very time consuming.

bpk 110 is very detailed in that you have to know sources of food and RDAs of the food groups. She's not that great at teaching and kind of boring but her exams are alright, if you can, take it with someone else.
Very hard class. Don't even bother reading from textbook its way too long and boring. Study off Lecture notes and  u should be able to get at least a C+.

She spends too much time talking about things not related to the course content at all. Constantly makes jokes only she laughs at. Lectures teach basic stuff but she expects you to know everything, avoid avoid avoid avoid

All you need to do is study her lecture slides. Midterm and final were hard, but the class must be scaled because you can do well without getting good grades on either. Spend a lot of time on the assignment as it is worth a lot, and easy to do well on.
The poor quality of this professor is a good example of the declination of our education system.

Let me put it this way: Leah + BPK110 = bad BPK110; you're basically memorizing the text. The TA Rodrigo, he was ok, difficult to understand & made simple questions/answers into Mt. Everest, like why?!  Just go with Bedoya or take the risk of a GPA slashing nightmare!

The class has interesting material but Leah manages to put the entire class to sleep by reciting the lecture slides word for word. Assignments in this class are completely useless in real life applications. Final is basically a memory dump.

Take this course with anyone other than Leah. Lecture slides were incorrect and when presented, was nonchalant, like seriously? Veers off topic during and a little condescending. Midterm = ok. Final = difficult (coming from a 3.50+ GPA student). Text is good, read it; the material is relevant and interesting. It's the instruction that is poor.

Leah could teach the material very well if only she talk about useful things that related to NUTRITION! Majority of lectures she would go off-topic and discuss things that had no relation to the class. She defends her point too much, didn't listen to students explanation if they asked for marks on an assignment or exam.
Schedules a midterm during a Canada vs. USA Olympic hockey game... Enough said.
attend class if you want to hear stories about her life and not actual material. Horrible at explaining and not helpful.
Terrible jokes all class long, talks to students like kindergarten kids.

She is so sweet and clearly wants to help you learn more about your body and improve your relationship with food. You have to buy her textbook and she teaches using a flipped classroom model. Her exams were hard but fair, and there were biweekly quizzes in tutorial. Make sure you stick on top of readings because there is a lot of material
Engaging lectures, but exams focus on minor details. Though textbook is required, unstuck study can be a helpful study tool alongside it. Overall, manageable with consistent effort.

Honestly her lecture videos are great and engaging, but then you get to the exam and it has not a SINGLE thing from the lecture, super frustrating. She asks the smallest details on the exams which is stupid. Assignments were easy but tbh don't take this class unless you need to.

Her online lectures were done well and she seems very nice. Her projects were interesting and well graded however, midterm asks lots of minor detailed questions and you need to read the textbook for them.

Pro: Teaches the material well and is passionate
Con: Exams focus on minor details. Exams are short answers, fill-in-the-blanks, and multiple choice. If you wish to get a high grade, you must read the textbook thoroughly. The questions in the exams require the ability to apply material, not definitions. Exams were unnecessarily stressful.
3 projects, midterm, final + biweekly quizzes. Easy course. Okay prof. Diana wasn't bad, but wasn't very accessible. Makes us buy her own textbook but its only $25 and you don't reallllly need it.
Worst course I have taken at SFU.
Literally so much material to remember in not enough time. Takes so long to mark simple assignments. Nice tho
Really enjoyed the lectures and felt like I got a lot out of them. They were engaging and informative. Diana is caring and truly wants you to do well in the course, she gives good guidance for exams.

The content was very interesting. Her projects were very straightforward but you really need the textbook as her slides do not cover enough information. However, she was impossible to get a hold of. Exams were insanely difficult as the questions were so specific. Hardest exam I have ever taken. Took as an elective and definitely not a GPA Booster.

Im not in BPK or science and did fine, if you took Bio 12 in high school you'll be totally fine taking this class, a lot of the same concepts. I took it online and her videos were helpful. the info you learn from this class is very useful outside of school but definitely isn't a GPA booster if you don't study. the assignments and quizzes were easy

Overly enthusiastic about this course. For the midterm and final, we had to stay on a Zoom meeting with video on and she checks IDs and makes everyone show their desk and surroundings which I found such a waste of time and so unnecessary. Her concepts are all based off of a textbook she wrote and is way too much work for an elective.

The tests were completely unreasonable for a first year course. I am graduating from SFU and this was a top 3 hardest class I have taken and it was an elective. Avoid this class and prof at all costs.

midterm and final are fairly graded
one ongoing project that you do throughout the semester that is relatively easy and low maintenance 
she is lovely and you can tell that she cares about her students and is passionate about her work

I really enjoyed BPK110. The lectures were asynchronous. Quizzes were open-book. Exams questions were very similar to practice quizzes and exams. There were no trick questions ever. The project was straightforward too. The class was interesting and the lecture videos made by the prof were informative and provided a great snapshot of the textbook.

Read the textbook, and take good notes and you'll get a decent grade just from that. If you stick it to the prerecorded lectures only, you'll do not so good. Her textbook is great, lectures vids are ok, great course though, favorite science elec, highly recommend if your into nutrition/fitness.

lots of papers and their topics not be posted until only 1 week before. Discussion board was barely monitored either by prof or TM. Not accessible by email. So you only have 1 office hour a week or dumb Instagram live which I personally didn't like. But course contents were well authored and textbook was written by the prof so it was succinct.

Diana is one of the best professors I've had at SFU! She creates engaging lectures and all of her exams/quizzes are tested from her slides or the assigned (2-3 pages) of reading. Would 100% recommend her! Amazing professor!

extremely frustrating class. content is interesting but diana and her TAs put zero effort in staying in contact with students... she encourages students to use discussion boards but these are monitored maybe once every three weeks

avoid this prof at all costs

Diana Bedoya seemed very kind at first but she was barely present for the learning process of this class. You basically have to teach yourself everything and the exams ask dumb questions that you don't learn about and never even think to google before an exam. She made it seem like she cares about your learning but barely interacts with students.
Made lectures very interesting and was easily accesible to watch and understand.

I was triggered by the harshness of the marking of the Mid-term and Quizzes. There really was no warning. There is a coldness in regards to student circumstances. If you are a sensitive person then it may be wise to avoid this prof. She isn't very understanding or personable on a deeper level, despite the outward show of friendliness.

Diana is the best prof I've had at SFU. A great course to fulfill your B-Sci. I took it distance ed, just watch the videos, read the textbook, and do the study questions and you will get a good grade. Content is straightforward.

Lots of reading (will basically read 400 pages by end). Content is interesting in terms of nutrition/exercise (took as elective). Assignments are very straightforward, can ask TA for clarification. Quizzes are also very easy as it's open book. Midterm/final tough, remember the smallest details, and lots of content. Genuine/caring prof.

Diana was super sweet and made her lecture videos easy to watch. If taking as an OLC class (I'm not sure about regular classes during COVID) the midterm and final are proctored, which made things a lot more stressful for me at least.

Diana Bedoya is an amazing prof and her exam questions are quite predictable. She makes this course fun even though there is a lot of content being provided. But yes, you have to review the material often to do well.

Diana is hands down one of the BEST profs at SFU. She delivers the most engaging lectures I have ever experienced (even for 8:30am classes) and is always very organized. All assignments and exams are straight out of the textbook so you always know what to expect. I am not a KIN major but being in her class definitely makes me want to switch!

Amazing professor and really chill and understanding. Outlines important concepts and highlights material likely to be found on exam. Quizzes and Exams are fair and come directly from the slides. For a distance ed. class she was extremely active and involved in the class. Office hours extremely helpful. Definitely recommend!

During the pandemic, she does weekly IGTV lives to engage with us. But she doesn't reply to emails and probably doesn't care to. She's not as easy as people make it, but she's also not the worst. Her energy is nice, but it doesn't make up for her high expectations. I studied a lot for the midterm and still did bad. Not easy for a 100 course.

Professor Bedoya is passionate about what she teaches her students! Her lectures are very well organized and she makes 8:30 am lectures interesting! Make sure to attend lectures, in order to understand specific slides more clearly and in-depth. If you have questions, she is always available during office hours! She is an amazing prof! :)
Such a good prof!! She was amazing!! She made an 8:30am class easy and exciting to attend and her lectures were very clear and organized. Best teacher ever!

I took nutrition online with Diana, so I've never had a class with her in person. However, her slides, textbook, and online structure really make the class easy to follow and provide good outlines of each chapter. Nutrition is still a science class, so get ready to read and memorize lots of terminology.

GREAT PROFFESSOR. Her lectures were so engaging and understandable. Not a dry class at all. Super kind and always answers students questions. Literally one of a the few 8:30am lectures that I could be totally interested in. Her assignments are relevant and you learn a lot of things in this class. Participation via iClicker is 10% of your grade.

Diana is 100% my favorite prof at SFU. She really cares about her students and applies the course material in a way to help us make healthier choices in our lives. Go to office hours if you're ever confused on the material as she is always willing to provide extra help. So glad I took both my science credits with her, would highly recommend!

I could listen to Diana for hours. You will learn so much from her that will be useful to apply to your own life. Diana is so nice & very approachable. She is 10/10 my favorite professor in SFU. Taking BPK 110 was very fun and enjoyable. Attendance is mandatory because of iclicker. Her notes are very good but you still need to red the textbook.

If you're looking for a super easy elective I wouldn't recommend Bpk 110. That being said if you put in the work and are really good at memorizing its an easy A+. Exams are pretty straight forward, just memorize the slides and as long as you show up to tutorial and lectures you'll get the grade. Projects were also almost a guaranteed 100%.

I clickers for attendance. MT/Final all based on lecture notes only. Easy if you've taken BISC 101 or even Bio 12. She gives good lectures but if you skip a few its no big deal. Go to tutorial to complete assignments and the TA is your crutch for the diet analysis project (which are easy marks if you follow the rubric). Good prof overall

Diana was an awesome prof. I took this course and enjoyed it a lot. However, if you want a great mark you have to work for it. The good thing is that she tells you whats going to be on the midterms/finals so showing up is crucial and that you should ONLY focus on the lecture notes. Use the textbook as a supplement!

Diana is a great prof. She spends a lot of time going over subjects that students have  had trouble with in the past and tries her best so that everyone understands. Coming from a science major, it was a little redundant but she still kept lecture entertaining. She also made an effort to eliminate the textbook.

Diana is a great professor. She is kind, cheerful and SO GORGEOUS (it was a little distracting lol). She makes it a lot easier to stay awake and learn at 8:30 AM. As someone who doesn't have a background in science the course required a lot of studying. It isn't easy but it is interesting and relevant to your own health! TA was not helpful at all.

She really cares about the subject and does her best to explain things clearly by drawing things out. Never bored during her lectures. Studying all the different types of vitamins and minerals got a little bit boring but overall great class.

Diana is by far one of the best profs I've had.  She is very knowledgeable and her lectures are very inspiring.  She gives a clear criteria on what will be on the exams.  However, her exams are kinda tough so be sure to study a lot!
Lectures are interesting but exams are not. You need to remember every single word on her lecture slide. Don't recommend if you don't have science background or a good memory.

Diana is an amazing lecturer. She is very passionate about the course content and inspires her students to have a healthy diet and lifestyle. Not an easy A if you do not have an interest in the course and not willing to memorize a ton of materials. Just invest in your time and you'll do great!

Diana is a wonderful prof. and she really cares about what she's teaching. She makes 8:30 lectures enjoyable with her attitude. The course requires a lot of work, especially time to memorize. The midterm/final exam multiple choice was quite tricky, but written questions come from her study guide. She gives marks for iClicker attendance, easy marks.

Tedious course for a science elective. Multiple choice is tricky too - the written response is pretty much out of her review package she gives before each exam (mid term and final) and FIB is from tutorial questions (easy). However, MC is where people tend to loose marks on tests because she tests from RANDOM slides.  So study EVERY slide for MC.
She's a caring prof who makes the 8:30 lectures enjoyable. Highly recommend taking BPK 110 with her.
GREAT PROF! Fair course.

I found this course to be a bit challenging until the final. I took it as an elective (I'm in business) and found this course to be a lot of effort. If you want a B-, B, or B+ a half ass attempt will get you it. But if you want A- or above you have to revise weekly and stay on top of EVERYTHING. Every mark counts for an A. That includes iClicker.

Honestly, I wish I never took this class as an science elective. There are easier science electives out there. The exams are pretty tricky. Do NOT bother studying the textbook unless specified. Diana/TAs may act like the textbook is necessary but it's not. She only tests from lecture slides. If you study both you'll end up overwhelmed.

Really nice, passionate about the topic and really goes in depth with explaining what you need to know. Wouldn't say class is mandatory unless you care about the 5% iClicker mark, b/c you can pretty much get the info you need off of her slides, but she does explain it in more detail. Tests are kinda hard - wants you to know word for word.

Such a good professor - would def take a class with her again. Made some of the topics which could have been very dry super interesting. She was very passionate about nutrition and it really translated in her teaching. Overall 100% recommend.

Diana is such a great prof!!! Clearly cares for her students and lectures are very enjoyable. Go to lecture for easy participation marks! If you need help, ask for it EARLY. Diana and your TA are very accessible and you should see them if you need help with the project or course content.  The material's not extremely hard, so just put in the work.
Passionate about the material and her teaching ability reflects that.

I really enjoyed Diana's enthusiasm during the lectures and she really cares for her students. Her assignments are not too bad and you can generally get a good mark on them. The weekly quizzes and the exams are full of specific details on her slides. So if you are someone who's great at memorizing, go for it.

Diana seems genuinely interested in what she teaches, which often makes it more interesting.  However, she makes it seem like some concepts will not be important for the final/midterm, but do not trust this.  She will test on anything.  Including from pictures.  Study her slides religiously, every single detail, and you will do well.

I LOVE DIANA! She's so funny, passionate about what she does and made it really easy to go to that 8:30am lecture! A lot of people say this is "easy credit" but it's not... Yes, she is very clear with what is on the exam, and the lecture slides have all the information you need but you do need to out in the time to memorize. However, loved it!!!

She is an incredible prof who is super passionate about her work. Her lectures are missable if need be because she posts all the slides on canvas, but I would not recommend it because she does detailed diagrams and goes way more in depth during lecture. And also gotta get that iclicker credit! She's funny and very likeable. Great teacher and person

She clearly enjoys what she teaches. Very engaging with her students and makes her early lectures enjoyable. Textbook is not needed but if you want to go that extra mile then go for it. Everything on midterms and exams is based on her lecture slides.

Most of the test material is from lectures (study questions that TAs post on Canvas are super helpful). If you've taken Bio 12 etc you'll have less trouble, but there's still detailed nutrition stuff that isn't covered in normal bio classes. The prof explores different views on nutrition issues and makes even 8:30AM lectures interesting!

This is more a review of the class since I never interacted with Professor Bedoya. The TM I was assigned to was awful, she did not have a great grasp of English and this made many instructions unclearconfusing. Overall the class was not hard, but you have to stay on top of assignments and study hard for the final if you want to do well.

BEST PROFESSOR AT SFU HANDS DOWN, I HAVE NEVER SEEN SUCH A GOOD TEACHER BEFORE. ALL HAIL THE QUEEN OF BPK!  PS. I GOT AN A+, AND I DID NOT TRY AS HARD AS I COULD HAVE, BECAUSE SHE MADE EVERYTHING CRYSTAL CLEAR 3

Diana is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. You can tell she loves what she teaches. Her midterm and final was fair. Make sure you attend lecture to receive 10% participation. There are weekly quizzes as well, but as long as you glance over the material before tutorial you'll be fine. I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS CLASS.
Diana's an amazing prof. She is extremely intelligent and is a wonderful lecturer. Her class was very interesting, and her passion for the topic is inspiring. Definitely worth taking.

Great professor! She's very passionate and interested in the field of nutrition and you see that from how she presents her lectures! Giving her a 3 for easiness because her class isn't easy but not really that difficult. Put in the time, stay organized week to week, don't leave it all to the end, and most of all ENJOY IT and you'll do great!

Diana is an extremely enthusiastic professor and she definitely knows how to properly deliver a lecture in a morning class. Her teaching style is crisp and her exams are very straight forward. Just study off her notes (textbook not needed) and you'll get an easy A for sure.

took this class for a science credit. it is by no means an easy A because you need to work at it, stay on top of the readings and memorize a lot of material for the midterm and final. however, the weekly tutorial quizzes helped to keep my understanding in check. motivational and super nice! the TA was terrible though. take it in burnaby!

Great prof. The course is challenging - there's a lot to learn and memorize. It is an enjoyable course, though. Diana has great insight for a lot of the issues (specifically diabetes and eating disorders) which i found to be pretty cool. She really knows what she's talking about and is very enthusiastic about the topics.
Hardest class ever . Interesting but exams are very tough . Get ready to memorize every single things cause you won't pass if you don't . I wish I never took it

She is a very good prof. Interesting morning classes to keep you awake. Assignments are not too bad and exams were fair. Found the final harder than the midterm though. There are also attendance marks so going to class may be a good idea. She is also very open to questions.

I went in with the idea that this would be an easy class for my science credit, but I had to work for it. It's a fast-paced class, and memorization is crucial. The material is extreeemely useful for your daily life, and I refer back to the content I learned all the time when making health decisions.

You need to study - hard. I am a social science student and am taking the class for science credit. The midterm average was 51%. I received an A, but I literally studied for 2 weeks every day straight. The course content is very interesting, however, if you don't want to put in the work, don't take the class. Prof seems amazing!

Diana is probably one of the best professors I've had - very clear, passionate, loud, and cheerful (definitely helps at 8:30 in the morning). She is very knowledgable about what she does and is always there to help. Her midterms are based off of her study questions and what she emphasises in class is very important. She doesn't try to trick you.

BPK 110 Online DONT TAKE IT. I completed the readings, re-read and fail on quizes because they're so ridiculously hard. I believe diana had so many "she's easy prof" reviews she went WAY out of her way to make this course living hell. Be prepared to get plummeted with 1000 unrelated facts and expect them on MT/Final.
To be honest, she is very nice and very helpful. But her midterm was soooooo hard. Take this class if you need it.
Had an awesome sense of humour, kept the course interesting, crystal clear with her expectations.

If you are not a science student like me, I don't think it will be a GPA booster class for you. Just had midterm today. It was fair and a little bit tough, NOT easy! I am a 3.8 GPA student in business, and I might receive a B in this class. Hope her  marking will be fair. TA Clara is nice. Overall a great teacher. Never makes me fall asleep at 830.
Awesome prof! Easy class. If your actually interested learning about health this class is for you. Just do the assignments and study for the exams and you'll easily end up with an A. Love Diana!!

Diana is a fantastic proff, very clear and passionate about health! She makes early morning starts not so bad! However, I found the exams to be extremely difficult. The TA's were terrible and confused my ability to learn material. I would study for quizzes and still do poor. Marking is a bit unfair. Diana as a lecturer is great though!

I found it a delightful course regardless of the work that had to be done, it is a science course so expect memorization! (Which isn't really all that much compared to most other courses I've taken). Diana is amazing! She knows how to teach and is really interested in the course material.

I really enjoyed this class. She is very very nice! Midterm was fair, multiple choice, short answers, and fill in the blanks! Only one assignment divided into 3 sections! Quizzes every week in tutorial!
awesome prof. very fair and makes the material very easy to understand. LOVE her

He gives straightforward lectures that are recorded so you can always review them later. Open to questions and is a great prof who knows his stuff. The course material was a lot of content memorization and he gives good tips on how to study for this course. Would recommend this prof to every student interested in BPK110.

Kevin is an awesome prof. He is very accessible outside of class and care about the students a lot. If you watch the lectures and read the textbook each week youll do well. Make sure to go to his office hours to help clarify concepts and prepare before exams.

Kevin uses Diana Bedoya's textbook and the material is really interesting. Assignments are great to apply your knowledge and tutorials can help a lot with reviewing and learning the materials. So, the class is not extremely difficult with Kevin, but definitely not an easy class. Kevin is also approachable and helpful if you reach out to him.

Awesome guy, always quick to respond to emails clearly and concisely. His lectures arent boring but arent exciting at all, pretty standard. He definitely knows what hes talking about, given his experienced background. Hes also really nice and seems like a genuinely great guy who is passionate about BPK.

As a 5th year Kin student, I can say that Kevin is easily one of the best profs of the department. He is clear, concise, and incredibly caring of all his students, plus his email reply game is on-point! His exams are a little rough because of the imposed time constraints but nothing in the exams are out of left field.
Super nice prof, very understanding, accommodating, and very accessible. I personally found bpk110 to be on the harder side for a 100 level course but Kevin is a great prof.

Kevin is a good prof and posts videos on youtube so you don't need to come to lecture! BPK110 is not a GPA booster lol. Idk why people said it was, but it has a lot of information that you need to memorise. Not an easy class if you're not in science.

I usually would never take a science course but it was mandatory and I thought oh god here we go but with the way Prof Lunnie structured it, I didn't find it so boring and actually quite liked learning about my own nutrition. There was a small quiz every week but it forced me to actually learn something by watching the lectures and taking notes.

Always watch the lectures because his quizzes have more of the content from it than the actual readings, so if you do only the readings you'll lose a few marks. Tutorials are mandatory, but really offer a lot of insight about what would be on the midterm etc. Kevin is super accessible outside of class, so make use of his office hours!
For BPK110 we had open-notes exams which really helped to not stress over them. Easy A class. Great prof.
It's pretty easy if you're good at memorizing notes.
avoid.

Do not take BPK 110 w/ Matt. His slides are like as if they were written decades ago, he uses a lot of acronyms that drive you CRAZY, he reads off his slides mainly; no point in going to lecture, he does not use Canvas and uses his own websites instead, TAs were not good; didn't know much about course

Midterm and final questions were hard. Material on tests is harder than textbook and lectures. I wouldn't recommend taking it unless it's absolutely necessary. Matt just reads off the slides for the whole two hours in lectures and tutorials were useless (no discussion of class materials most of the time)
He expects us to memorize hours of him reading off of slide verbatim. Brutal professor.

BORING LECTURES, He reads his lectures for 2 hours straight. Mid term and Final require extreme memorization. Also the tests seemed to focus heavily on concepts that were not stressed in lectures at all. Wouldn't recommend unless you need to take his class.

Matthew should be ashamed of himself for not teaching textbook materials. He makes the hardest test which lead to AVG of 64. Slides are dry and useless for test. He is unwilling to answer student's questions and often late for lecture. Be prepare to teach yourself/memorized details/ do presentations

The presentation slides were blue and yellow wish made it hard to focus, he just read off the slides and would barely give extra information. He would post the slides on a website but doesn't use canvas. There is tutorial work that is mandatory to complete, there is also a presentation by the end of the semester too.

Super great prof. Very straightforward, and all the content you need to know is in his lecture slides. You use the textbook for assignmentsfurther clarification and studying. It isn't mandatory. CONTENT-HEAVY course. Exams are clear and easy if you study enough. Assignments are also straightforward. An easy AB class. Funny and passionate.

Amazing Prof. Need to memorize quite a bit of stuff but other wise his testes are fair and he grades fairly too. No surprises. Just read his lecture notes, don't even bother with the textbook except for the assignments.
